data.title: Adult – Page 5 – Shelley Lowry Talent – Talent Agency Belfast, Dublin & London
data.text:
Mia Robbins is a talented actor with a rich cultural background. Born in Hong Kong and raised in England, Mia is of Eurasian heritage.

Her journey into the acting industry is unconventional as she initially started taking acting classes to support her son’s aspirations. This ignited a passion for acting and encouraged Mia to hone her skills through regular acting classes for Film and TV, as well as one-on-one lessons with a leading Voice and Acting Coach.

Her extensive travels, having lived in eight countries, has given Mia a unique perspective, inspiring diverse, empathetic and engaging performances.

She is bilingual, fluent in Cantonese and English.

Bláthnaid started her career in London immediately after training and has recently moved back home to continue her Career in Northern Ireland.

She has performed in theatres across both Northern Ireland and London such as The Lyric theatre, Belfast and The White Bear Theatre, London.

Her talents are not limited to this as she also has experience behind the camera. Bláthnaid has enjoyed leading roles in an online commercial, a short film, theatre performances and a supporting role in a feature film.

Bláthnaid also has experience teaching Drama, Music, Singing, and Music Theatre both privately and through Future Stars Performing Arts in London

‘Dear Body’, Short, 2022, Role of Woman, BBCNI Two Minute Masterpieces, Dir: Caitlin Magnall-Kearns

“Wee Buns”, Rehearsed Reading, 2021, Role of Mel, The Lyric Theatre, Dir: Katherine Nesbitt

“This is the Night Mail”, Feature Film, 2020, Role of Joolie, Unquiet Skills, Dir: Joanne Reay

‘Always on Brand’ Commercial, 2019, Role of Hero Girl, We Are Social Studios, Dir: Jon Riche

Born and raised in Belfast, Bernadette has been acting since she was a teenager. She began her love of acting in community theatre; she then went on to study Drama at BIFHE and then at Queens University, Belfast.

After graduating she starred in her first ever professional production in 2004. Bernadette has over 19 years experience in Film, Television & Theatre.

Give My Head Peace – Television – BBC One/Hole In The Wall Gang, Director Micheal McDowell

Blue Lights – Television – BBC Kill House Women, Director Gilles Bannier

Hope Street – Television – Britbox/BBC, Director Sean Glynn

Nowhere Special – Feature Film, Director Uberto Pasolini

Say Nothing – Disney FX Dir Michael Lennox.

Gary Duffy began training with Shelley Lowry in 2022.

Gary is currently in rehearsals as a mic’d chorus member and understudy for The Dame in Beauty and the Beast on London’s West End.

Gary is a singer/songwriter and has released 7 singles with the latest two charting in the top 40 on ‘UK ITunes Charts’.

Gary has appeared both on stage as well as in front of the camera in various music videos. And you can find his original songs on many music platforms.

Gary performed at the Electric Love Festival in 2022 in Belfast and also had his first headline show performing his original music in the Limelight in Belfast.

Shane is a well known and much loved comedian from Northern Ireland.

He is also a writer, podcaster and a talented actor.

Shane has just recently returned from an Australian stand up tour, and has supported US comics Kevin Hart and Bill Burr.

Anna Curry has had a passion for acting from a young age and has appeared in numerous theatre productions with Belvoir Players’ Studio Theatre.

She studied screen acting at Mark Hudson’s Manchester School of Acting from 2021-2023. She is currently attending acting for TV and Film with Shelley Lowry and casting director Mary Ellen O’Hara. Anna has also participated in various voiceover, stage combat and accent workshops.

‘Spar ‘Mega Deals’ Commercial

Short film ‘Fete Accomplis’ – Peter Parry Productions

James has been working as an actor since the mid 1980s.

As you can imagine James’ credits are extensive. An accomplished stage actor he has appeared in many productions including:

‘The Chronicles of Long Kesh’, ‘Titanic’, ‘Gibraltar Strait’ and most recently ‘Carson and The Lady’ at the Lyric.

His film/television credits include ‘Game Of Thrones,’ ‘Best, A Mother’s Son,’ and ‘The Prisoner.’

Theatre critic Michael Quinn wrote a review of James’ performance in ‘Carson and The Lady’

Quinn noted that the production featured a ‘typically charismatic performance by James Doran as Edward Carson’

And ‘Under the radar, Doran has become one of Northern Ireland’s most compelling actors and here he brings nuanced stature and substance to a controversial figure with utter conviction and a lightly-worn but engaging gravitas.’

Aimee trained in Acting at Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts.

She has worked professionally in many Feature Films, Short Films and Television Productions.

Aimee co-starred with Ian McElhinney in 2021 in ‘Salvation Calling’. Which was nominated for Best Lockdown Programme – Comedy, Entertainment & Scripted in the Broadcast Digital Awards.

In 2021, Aimee was nominated for Best Actress at Long Story Shorts International Film Festival for her performance in the short film ‘The Familiar Sting’ directed by Joe McStravick.
